channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Tue, 27 Aug 2024 09:39:11 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Earthquake of 5.9 magnitude strikes Darwin
item.description: A 5.9 magnitude earthquake struck the Banda Sea, near Darwin, Australia, on Tuesday, reported at a depth of 62 km. The Bureau of Meteorology confirmed there was no tsunami threat.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Barcelona or die.' For Senegalese dreaming of Europe, the deadly Atlantic route is not a deterrent
item.description: Salamba Ndiaye, a young Senegalese woman, has repeatedly tried to reach Spain to escape poverty and lack of job opportunities. Despite past failures and dangers of the Atlantic route, she remains determined. The depletion of fish stocks due to international agreements has worsened local living conditions, pushing many to risk their lives for better prospects in Europe.

item.title: Canada to slap 100% tariff on Chinese electric vehicles
item.description: Canada announced a 100 per cent tariff on Chinese electric vehicles and a 25 per cent tariff on steel and aluminum imports from China. This move aligns with similar actions by the US and EU in response to China's market practices, aiming to protect Canada's interests in the global electric vehicle supply chain.

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg says he was ‘pressured’ by Joe Biden to pull Covid content
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg claimed that Facebook was pressured by the US government to censor COVID-19 content during the pandemic and expressed regret over their compliance. Facebook removed over 20 million posts, sparking criticism. Zuckerberg's letter to the US House Judiciary Committee highlighted the debate on the extent of content moderation on social media platforms.

item.title: Australia announces cap on international student enrolment for 2025
item.description: Australia announced a cap of 270,000 on international student enrolment for 2025 to manage record migration levels. This decision, part of broader reforms, aims to address rising home rental prices. The education sector remains a significant export industry, but high immigration has strained the housing market, becoming a key issue ahead of the next election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mpox: Germany to give Africa 100,000 doses of vaccine
item.description: Germany announced it would donate 100,000 mpox vaccine doses to the Democratic Republic of Congo and other African nations to control an outbreak. This donation nearly depletes Germany's military reserve and includes financial support. Other countries, like France and the US, have also pledged doses to combat the disease spreading in multiple African countries and beyond.

item.title: Hawaii faces flooding and road closures as three Cyclones stir in Pacific
item.description: Three tropical cyclones were active in the Pacific Ocean on Monday. Tropical Storm Hone brought heavy rainfall to Hawaii, resulting in flash floods and power outages. Hurricane Gilma and Tropical Storm Hector gained strength, moving eastward. Residents on the Big Island took precautions against potential future flooding as Hone reminded them of last year's devastating Maui wildfires.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel minister says would build synagogue at flashpoint Jerusalem site
item.description: Far-right Israeli minister Itamar Ben Gvir expressed his desire to build a synagogue at Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound, sparking outrage. The compound, an important site for both Muslims and Jews, has long-standing restrictions on religious activities for non-Muslims.

item.title: Yunus promises interfaith harmony in Bangladesh
item.description: Bangladesh interim govt chief advisor Prof Muhammad Yunus expressed his aim to create a society where all citizens can practice their faith without fear. Addressing Hindu leaders, Yunus emphasized ensuring justice for all and protecting property rights, while Hindu communities suspended flood-stricken Janmashtami celebrations. BNP highlighted the absence of a defined roadmap for democratic transition in Yunus' speech.

item.title: Russia's deadly overnight barrage of missiles and drones hits over half of Ukraine
item.description: Russia launched a massive missile and drone attack across Ukraine, targeting critical energy infrastructure, killing four and injuring over a dozen people. This extensive assault resulted in power and water outages. Ukrainian officials urged allies for long-range weapons to counteract. The US condemned the attack and prioritized defense aid to Ukraine.

item.title: Canada to cut number of temp foreign workers
item.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced reductions in temporary foreign workers for low-wage jobs to address rising local unemployment. Changes to the Temporary Worker Program include halving contract durations and imposing a 10% cap on foreign hires. Exemptions will apply to sectors like agriculture and healthcare due to severe staffing shortages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine hit with 200 missiles, drones
'We welcome any nation ... ': What White House said on PM Modi's talk with US president Joe Biden
item.description: Following a phone conversation between President Biden and PM Modi, the White House praised Modi's recent historic visits to Poland and Ukraine. Modi briefed Biden on his trip and reiterated India's stance on resolving the conflict through dialogue and diplomacy, emphasizing peace and stability in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 90s UK rock band Oasis to reunite? 'definitely maybe'
When RFK Jr's daughter who's hanging out with Ben Affleck told how her father beheaded dead whale
item.description: ​Kennedy Jr had weird things going on with dead animals and he has been surprisingly candid about all these. Once he found a fatally hit bear cub early one morning. He wanted to take it home but then got distracts and the next thing we know, it was found in New York's Central Park. The 2014 mystery incident could be solved a decade later when Kennedy Jr claimed that it was he who placed the bear there.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fighting sexual temptation? Play badminton, Hong Kong tells teens
Yacht's captain under probe for manslaughter
Scientist claims he knows where missing MH370 went: 'Perfect hiding spot lies in...'
item.description: Australian scientists Vincent Lyne has claimed in LinkedIn that he knows where the missing MH370 is, he's found the perfect hiding place from the plane that went missing in 2014 with 239 people on board -- never to be found. His theory is that the plane was deliberately crashed into a a depth of 20,000 ft on the Indian Ocean's Broken Ridge. Filled with fine sediments, it is the perfect hiding place for the MH-370, the scientist said concluding that the pilot of the plane Ahmad Shah deliberately crashed it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard officially endorses Donald Trump: 'He will walk us back from brink of war'
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard, former Democratic leader, Monday officially endorsed Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump in Detroit and said she is confident that Trump will take the country back from the brink of war. ​"We can't be prosperous unless we are at peace and we can't be free as long as we have a government that is retaliating against its political opponents and undermining our civil liberties weaponizing our very institutions against those they deem as threat. Kamala Harris has done this in the last three years. She won't hesitate to do this if she's elected," Tulsi said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's X-treme comeback: A two-hour rant with capital letters and catchy insults
item.description: Former President Donald Trump resumed posting on X after a long hiatus, critiquing the Democratic Party and Vice President Kamala Harris. In six posts within two hours, Trump accused Harris of poor leadership and forecasted a dire future under her presidency, touching on foreign policy and economic issues. He urged supporters to vote for him in 2024.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
